result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert M Foots was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as anger management and cognitive therapy. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. No contact with any child under the age of 18 without permission of their parent or guardian with exception of defendant's own child. Must register with sex offender registry and be compliant with all rules thereof for 15 years.  DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert M Foots

Per RCSO, DNA collected - 09-02-2015 at 10:05

Defendant Robert M Foots in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for Rebecca Sommers for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties.  This is a Ch. 980 and body armor eligible offense. State recommends I/S WPS, amount left to the Court. 4-5 yrs probation with conditions left up to the Court.

BTC: Total sentence is 5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES/CFTS - STAYED. 4 yrs probation

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs

no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as anger management and cognitive therapy
Ft emp/school

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim, directly or indirectly, or her family.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. AMENDED 03-03-2015 - DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND JOB INTERVIEWS AND SUBSEQUENT EMPLOYMENT AS LONG AS THEY ARE PRE-APPROVED BY ZCI
Status conference on March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert M Foots in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that she still needed additional discovery and she has, in fact, received discovery but has not had opportunity to go over that information with the defendant. Defense is asking for a couple weeks to ensure that occurs. Ms. Moore is asking for release for purposes of work. Deft has an interview this afternoon at 2:30 pm at Buffalo Wild Wings. The Court notes that there is no formal motion filed for bond review and indicates there are 950 issues. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950

BTC: Two week adj is granted. Bond may be modified. Deft may attend job interviews as long as deft has prior approval and if hired, work schedule must be approved by ZCI  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
